findings.title: Local File Inclusion (Path Traversal)
findings.description: Parameter 'file' is vulnerable to path traversal/LFI. File contents pattern detected in response.
findings.evidence: Matched pattern: root:x:0:0
findings.remediation: Validate file paths against a whitelist of allowed files. Use realpath() or similar to canonicalize paths. Chroot the application. Never pass user input directly to file functions.

findings.title: SQL Injection (Error-Based via Form) — MySQL
findings.description: Form field 'uname' at http://testphp.vulnweb.com/login.php is vulnerable to SQL injection. A database error from MySQL was triggered.
findings.evidence: DB Error matched: you have an error in your sql syntax
findings.remediation: Use parameterized queries (prepared statements) instead of string concatenation. Apply input validation and whitelist allowable characters. Use an ORM with built-in escaping. Apply the principle of least privilege to database accounts. Implement a WAF as a defense-in-depth measure.

findings.evidence: DB Error matched: you have an error in your sql syntax
findings.remediation: Use parameterized queries (prepared statements) instead of string concatenation. Apply input validation and whitelist allowable characters. Use an ORM with built-in escaping. Apply the principle of least privilege to database accounts. Implement a WAF as a defense-in-depth measure.

findings.title: Missing Security Header: Strict-Transport-Security
findings.description: The 'Strict-Transport-Security' security header is not present. Enforces HTTPS connections.
findings.evidence: Header absent. Recommended: Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains
findings.remediation: Add the header: Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains

findings.title: Missing Security Header: Content-Security-Policy
findings.description: The 'Content-Security-Policy' security header is not present. Prevents XSS and data injection attacks.
findings.evidence: Header absent. Recommended: Content-Security-Policy: default-src 'self'
findings.remediation: Add the header: Content-Security-Policy: default-src 'self'

findings.title: Site Not Using HTTPS
findings.description: The target URL uses unencrypted HTTP, exposing all data in transit.
findings.remediation: Configure SSL/TLS and redirect all HTTP traffic to HTTPS.

findings.title: Reflected XSS via Form — Field 'uname'
findings.description: Form field 'uname' at http://testphp.vulnweb.com/login.php reflects user input into the response without adequate encoding.
findings.evidence: manual that corresponds to your MySQL server version for the right syntax to use near 'onmouseover='VULNSCAN_XSS_EVENT' x='' AND pass='test'' at line 1
findings.remediation: Encode all user-controlled data before inserting into HTML output using context-aware encoding (HTML, JavaScript, CSS, URL). Implement a Content Security Policy (CSP) header. Use modern frameworks that auto-escape template variables. Validate and whitelist expected input on the server side. Set the HttpOnly and Secure flags on cookies.

findings.remediation: Add the header: X-Frame-Options: DENY or SAMEORIGIN

findings.description: The 'X-Content-Type-Options' security header is not present. Prevents MIME type sniffing.

findings.remediation: Add the header: X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff

findings.title: CSRF — POST Form Missing Anti-CSRF Token
findings.description: The POST form at http://testphp.vulnweb.com/userinfo.php does not appear to contain an anti-CSRF token. This may allow cross-site request forgery attacks.
findings.evidence:
Form action: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/userinfo.php
Fields: uname, pass
findings.remediation: Implement CSRF tokens: generate a cryptographically random token per session/form. Verify the token server-side on all state-changing requests. Also set SameSite=Strict/Lax on session cookies as defense-in-depth.
